text:
I noticed that I'm no longer reading an article, blog post, etc. I just scroll through it and close the page. It' really very rare that I spend time on some blog post, but I do read books, and I do it more than ever.

Are we slowly losing a joy of reading blog post because there are so many? Are the books gaining popularity again? What are your thoughts?
title: I don't read web articles anymore, but I read books
U.S. safety agency to consider ban on gas stoves amid health fears
Can the double-slit experiment distinguish between quantum interpretations?
A Mental Health App Tested ChatGPT on Its Users
Artist banned from art subreddit because their work looked AI-generated
The DIY scientist, the Olympian, and the mutated gene (2016)
Vulkan video shenanigans – FFmpeg and RADV integration experiments
Why Intermittent Fasting Has So Many Health Benefits
Thousands of scientists publish a paper every five days (2018)

text:
I don’t have a great deal of medical knowledge. My mother was diagnosed with ovarian cancer, and I would like to see if anyone here knows of good sources of information.

My mother had a full hysterectomy this week and the medical team believes they were able to remove all visible signs of cancer. Following recovery, she’ll likely start chemotherapy to help kill off any remaining cancer.
title: Ask HN: What good sources of information on ovarian cancer treatments?
Seattle Public Schools sues TikTok, YouTube, Instagram over youth mental health
The physics principle of diffusion inspired modern AI art

text: Apparently Multi Collagen Protein is a thing now, but I can't tell if it's bullshit or not.
title: Ask HN: What supplements do you take that have good scientific backing?
Fourth membrane is discovered in the brain
Things I wish I knew before founding my mental health startup
